<scratchpad>
Key functional/non-functional information extracted:
1. Vehicle structure definition needed
2. Vehicle composed of multiple components
3. Major components: 1 engine, 1 transmission, 4 wheels
4. Components are subclasses of vehicle components
5. Compositional relationships with quantity requirements
6. Exactly 4 wheels, 1 engine, 1 transmission
7. System should support extensibility for vehicle and component types
8. Need to accommodate different configurations and varieties

Mapping to SysML v2:
- Use part definitions for Vehicle, VehicleComponent, Engine, Transmission, Wheel
- Use specialization (subclassing) for component types
- Use part usages with multiplicity for composition
- Use abstract definitions for extensibility
</scratchpad>

package VehicleStructure {
    
    abstract part def VehicleComponent;
    
    part def Engine :> VehicleComponent;
    
    part def Transmission :> VehicleComponent;
    
    part def Wheel :> VehicleComponent;
    
    abstract part def Vehicle {
        part engine : Engine[1];
        part transmission : Transmission[1];
        part wheels : Wheel[4];
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirement step by step:

1. Key Components:
   - System: Vehicle-Trailer Connection Management System
   - Parts: Vehicle (with chassis and tow ball), Trailer (with coupler and trailer frame)
   - Interfaces: Connection between tow ball and coupler

2. Key Functions:
   - Connect trailer to vehicle
   - Disconnect trailer from vehicle
   - Manage connection status

3. Key Attributes/States:
   - Connection status (connected/disconnected)
   - Safety and reliability aspects

4. SysML v2 Mapping:
   - Use package for overall system
   - Define parts for Vehicle and Trailer
   - Define subparts for chassis, tow ball, coupler, trailer frame
   - Define interface/connection between tow ball and coupler
   - Define actions for connect and disconnect operations
   - Define states for connection status
</scratchpad>

package VehicleTrailerConnectionSystem {
    
    part def Vehicle {
        part chassis : Chassis;
        part towBall : TowBall;
    }
    
    part def Trailer {
        part coupler : Coupler;
        part trailerFrame : TrailerFrame;
    }
    
    part def Chassis;
    part def TowBall;
    part def Coupler;
    part def TrailerFrame;
    
    interface def TowBallCouplerInterface {
        end towBallEnd : TowBall;
        end couplerEnd : Coupler;
    }
    
    part vehicleTrailerSystem : VehicleTrailerSystem {
        part vehicle : Vehicle;
        part trailer : Trailer;
        
        interface : TowBallCouplerInterface connect 
            vehicle.towBall to trailer.coupler;
        
        attribute connectionStatus : ConnectionStatusType;
        
        action connectTrailer {
            in item vehicle : Vehicle;
            in item trailer : Trailer;
            out item connectedSystem : VehicleTrailerSystem;
            
            bind connectionStatus = ConnectionStatusType::connected;
        }
        
        action disconnectTrailer {
            in item connectedSystem : VehicleTrailerSystem;
            out item vehicle : Vehicle;
            out item trailer : Trailer;
            
            bind connectionStatus = ConnectionStatusType::disconnected;
        }
    }
    
    part def VehicleTrailerSystem {
        part vehicle : Vehicle;
        part trailer : Trailer;
    }
    
    enum def ConnectionStatusType {
        connected;
        disconnected;
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Key functional/non-functional information extracted:
1. System purpose: Model and analyze quality attributes of vehicles
2. Components: Vehicle (whole), Engine, Transmission, Front Axle Assembly, Rear Axle Assembly
3. Key attribute: Mass/quality data for each component
4. Functions:
   - Input quality data for components
   - Aggregate and calculate total vehicle mass
   - Define quality analysis requirements
   - Formulate analysis use cases
   - Generate analysis tasks and plans based on objectives
   - Evaluate and track requirements
   - Support vehicle design and performance optimization

Mapping to SysML v2:
- Package for organization
- Part definitions for vehicle and components
- Attributes for mass/quality
- Requirements for quality analysis
- Use cases for analysis scenarios
- Analysis cases for quality evaluation
- Calculations for mass aggregation
- Connections between parts
</scratchpad>

package VehicleQualityAnalysisSystem {
    import ScalarValues::*;
    import ISQ::*;
    import SI::*;
    
    attribute def QualityData {
        attribute mass : MassValue;
        attribute qualityScore : Real;
        attribute timestamp : String;
    }
    
    part def Engine {
        attribute qualityData : QualityData;
    }
    
    part def Transmission {
        attribute qualityData : QualityData;
    }
    
    part def FrontAxleAssembly {
        attribute qualityData : QualityData;
    }
    
    part def RearAxleAssembly {
        attribute qualityData : QualityData;
    }
    
    part def Vehicle {
        part engine : Engine;
        part transmission : Transmission;
        part frontAxle : FrontAxleAssembly;
        part rearAxle : RearAxleAssembly;
        
        attribute totalMass : MassValue = 
            engine.qualityData.mass + 
            transmission.qualityData.mass + 
            frontAxle.qualityData.mass + 
            rearAxle.qualityData.mass;
            
        attribute overallQualityScore : Real;
    }
    
    requirement def QualityAnalysisRequirement {
        doc /* Quality analysis requirements for vehicle and components */
        attribute targetMass : MassValue;
        attribute minQualityScore : Real;
    }
    
    requirement vehicleQualityReq : QualityAnalysisRequirement {
        doc /* Overall vehicle quality requirements */
        targetMass = 1500[kg];
        minQualityScore = 0.85;
    }
    
    use case def QualityAnalysisUseCase {
        subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        objective {
            doc /* Analyze quality attributes and generate evaluation */
        }
    }
    
    use case inputComponentData : QualityAnalysisUseCase {
        doc /* Input quality data for each component */
    }
    
    use case calculateTotalMass : QualityAnalysisUseCase {
        doc /* Aggregate and calculate total vehicle mass */
    }
    
    use case generateAnalysisPlan : QualityAnalysisUseCase {
        doc /* Generate analysis tasks and plans based on objectives */
    }
    
    analysis def QualityEvaluation {
        subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        objective {
            doc /* Comprehensive evaluation of vehicle quality */
        }
        
        return massCompliance : Boolean = vehicle.totalMass <= vehicleQualityReq.targetMass;
        return qualityCompliance : Boolean = vehicle.overallQualityScore >= vehicleQualityReq.minQualityScore;
    }
    
    analysis vehicleQualityAnalysis : QualityEvaluation {
        subject vehicle : Vehicle;
    }
    
    part vehicleInstance : Vehicle {
        part engine {
            :>> qualityData {
                mass = 200[kg];
                qualityScore = 0.9;
            }
        }
        part transmission {
            :>> qualityData {
                mass = 150[kg];
                qualityScore = 0.88;
            }
        }
        part frontAxle {
            :>> qualityData {
                mass = 300[kg];
                qualityScore = 0.87;
            }
        }
        part rearAxle {
            :>> qualityData {
                mass = 350[kg];
                qualityScore = 0.86;
            }
        }
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key functional/non-functional information:
   - System: Vehicle Safety and Anti-theft Function Catalogue
   - Purpose: Standardize basic configuration requirements for vehicle components
   - Two main aspects: Safety and Anti-theft performance
   
2. Component categories:
   - Basic safety components (mandatory): front seat belts, bumpers
   - Optional safety components: driver's airbag, anti-lock braking system (ABS)
   - Security components: alarm system, keyless entry system
   - Components can affect: safety only, anti-theft only, or both
   
3. Requirements:
   - Must ensure fundamental personal safety of occupants
   - Must enhance overall security and protective capability
   - Must meet regulatory requirements
   - Must meet users' needs for basic safety and protection
   
4. SysML v2 mapping:
   - Use package for the catalogue
   - Use part definitions for component types
   - Use requirements for safety/security requirements
   - Use attributes for component properties
   - Use constraints for mandatory vs optional
   - Use allocations to show which components satisfy which requirements
</scratchpad>

package VehicleSafetyAntiTheftCatalogue {
    
    import ScalarValues::*;
    
    enum def ComponentCategory {
        enum safety;
        enum antiTheft;
        enum safetyAndAntiTheft;
    }
    
    enum def ConfigurationStatus {
        enum mandatory;
        enum optional;
    }
    
    attribute def SafetyLevel :> Real {
        doc /* Level of safety protection provided */
    }
    
    part def VehicleComponent {
        attribute category : ComponentCategory;
        attribute status : ConfigurationStatus;
        attribute safetyLevel : SafetyLevel;
    }
    
    part def SafetyComponent :> VehicleComponent {
        attribute category redefines VehicleComponent::category = ComponentCategory::safety;
    }
    
    part def AntiTheftComponent :> VehicleComponent {
        attribute category redefines VehicleComponent::category = ComponentCategory::antiTheft;
    }
    
    part def DualPurposeComponent :> VehicleComponent {
        attribute category redefines VehicleComponent::category = ComponentCategory::safetyAndAntiTheft;
    }
    
    part def FrontSeatBelt :> SafetyComponent {
        attribute status redefines VehicleComponent::status = ConfigurationStatus::mandatory;
        doc /* Basic safety component for occupant protection */
    }
    
    part def Bumper :> SafetyComponent {
        attribute status redefines VehicleComponent::status = ConfigurationStatus::mandatory;
        doc /* Basic safety component for collision protection */
    }
    
    part def DriverAirbag :> SafetyComponent {
        attribute status redefines VehicleComponent::status = ConfigurationStatus::optional;
        doc /* Enhanced safety feature for driver protection */
    }
    
    part def AntiLockBrakingSystem :> SafetyComponent {
        attribute status redefines VehicleComponent::status = ConfigurationStatus::optional;
        doc /* ABS - Enhanced safety feature for braking control */
    }
    
    part def AlarmSystem :> AntiTheftComponent {
        attribute status redefines VehicleComponent::status = ConfigurationStatus::optional;
        doc /* Security component for theft deterrence */
    }
    
    part def KeylessEntrySystem :> AntiTheftComponent {
        attribute status redefines VehicleComponent::status = ConfigurationStatus::optional;
        doc /* Security component for access control */
    }
    
    part def Vehicle {
        part bodyAndInterior {
            part frontSeatBelts : FrontSeatBelt[2];
            part bumpers : Bumper[2];
            part driverAirbag : DriverAirbag[0..1];
        }
        
        part brakingSystem {
            part abs : AntiLockBrakingSystem[0..1];
        }
        
        part securitySystem {
            part alarm : AlarmSystem[0..1];
            part keylessEntry : KeylessEntrySystem[0..1];
        }
    }
    
    requirement def SafetyRequirement {
        doc /* Requirements for vehicle safety performance */
    }
    
    requirement def AntiTheftRequirement {
        doc /* Requirements for vehicle security performance */
    }
    
    requirement fundamentalPersonalSafety : SafetyRequirement {
        doc /* Ensure the fundamental personal safety of occupants */
        require constraint {
            Vehicle::bodyAndInterior::frontSeatBelts->size() >= 2 and
            Vehicle::bodyAndInterior::bumpers->size() >= 2
        }
    }
    
    requirement enhancedSecurityCapability : AntiTheftRequirement {
        doc /* Enhance the overall security and protective capability of the vehicle */
    }
    
    requirement regulatoryCompliance : SafetyRequirement {
        doc /* Meet regulatory requirements for vehicle safety */
        subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        require constraint {
            vehicle.bodyAndInterior.frontSeatBelts->forAll(fb | fb.status == ConfigurationStatus::mandatory) and
            vehicle.bodyAndInterior.bumpers->forAll(b | b.status == ConfigurationStatus::mandatory)
        }
    }
    
    requirement userSafetyNeeds : SafetyRequirement {
        doc /* Meet users' needs for the most basic safety functions */
    }
    
    requirement userProtectionNeeds : AntiTheftRequirement {
        doc /* Meet users' needs for the most basic protection functions */
    }
    
    allocation mandatorySafetyAllocation {
        allocate fundamentalPersonalSafety to FrontSeatBelt;
        allocate fundamentalPersonalSafety to Bumper;
    }
    
    allocation securityAllocation {
        allocate enhancedSecurityCapability to AlarmSystem;
        allocate enhancedSecurityCapability to KeylessEntrySystem;
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key functional/non-functional information:
   - Vehicle system with safety and security compliance configurations
   - Interior components:
     - 2 seat belts (mandatory safety features)
     - 1 airbag in cockpit (optional)
     - 1 anti-theft alarm device (security)
   - Body components:
     - 1 bumper (required safety component)
     - 1 keyless entry system (security)
   - Chassis components:
     - 2 wheels
     - 2 anti-lock braking systems (optional)
   - All components subject to identification and classification management
   - Goal: ensure compliance with safety and security regulations

2. SysML v2 mapping:
   - Use package for overall model
   - Use part definitions for component types
   - Use parts with multiplicity for instances
   - Use attributes for properties like mandatory/optional
   - Use requirements for compliance needs
   - Use allocation for mapping requirements to parts
</scratchpad>

package VehicleSafetySecuritySystem {
    
    part def Vehicle {
        part interior : Interior;
        part body : Body;
        part chassis : Chassis;
    }
    
    part def Interior {
        part seatBelts : SeatBelt[2];
        part airbag : Airbag[0..1];
        part antiTheftAlarm : AntiTheftAlarm[1];
    }
    
    part def Body {
        part bumper : Bumper[1];
        part keylessEntrySystem : KeylessEntrySystem[1];
    }
    
    part def Chassis {
        part wheels : Wheel[2];
        part absSystem : AntiLockBrakingSystem[0..2];
    }
    
    part def SeatBelt {
        attribute isMandatory : Boolean = true;
        attribute category : String = "Safety";
    }
    
    part def Airbag {
        attribute isMandatory : Boolean = false;
        attribute category : String = "Safety";
    }
    
    part def AntiTheftAlarm {
        attribute isMandatory : Boolean = true;
        attribute category : String = "Security";
    }
    
    part def Bumper {
        attribute isMandatory : Boolean = true;
        attribute category : String = "Safety";
    }
    
    part def KeylessEntrySystem {
        attribute isMandatory : Boolean = true;
        attribute category : String = "Security";
    }
    
    part def Wheel {
        attribute isMandatory : Boolean = true;
        attribute category : String = "Chassis";
    }
    
    part def AntiLockBrakingSystem {
        attribute isMandatory : Boolean = false;
        attribute category : String = "Safety";
    }
    
    requirement def SafetyCompliance {
        doc /* All mandatory safety components must be installed and functional */
    }
    
    requirement def SecurityCompliance {
        doc /* All security components must meet regulatory standards */
    }
    
    requirement def ComponentManagement {
        doc /* All safety and security components must be identified and classified */
    }
    
    part vehicle : Vehicle {
        satisfy requirement safetyReq : SafetyCompliance;
        satisfy requirement securityReq : SecurityCompliance;
        satisfy requirement managementReq : ComponentManagement;
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key entities/components:
   - Car/Vehicle (mass: 1200 kg, length: 4.82 m)
   - Wheel assemblies (multiple)
   - Wheel (composed of rim and tire)
   - Rim (diameter: 18 inches)
   - Tire (width: 245 mm, height: 45 mm, default tread depth: 6.0 mm)
   - Brake disc (radius: 95 mm)

2. Key relationships:
   - Car has multiple wheel assemblies
   - Each wheel assembly has a wheel and a brake disc
   - Each wheel consists of a rim and a tire

3. Key constraints:
   - Tire tread depth must be >= 3.5 mm (safety regulation)
   - Brake disc diameter must be < wheel outer diameter
   - Outer diameter calculation based on rim diameter and tire dimensions

4. Mapping to SysML v2:
   - Use part definitions for components
   - Use attributes for properties with units
   - Use part usages for composition
   - Use constraints for the safety and fitment requirements
   - Use calculations for derived values
</scratchpad>

package AutomotiveComponentModel {
    import ISQ::*;
    import SI::*;
    
    part def Vehicle {
        attribute mass : MassValue = 1200 [kg];
        attribute length : LengthValue = 4.82 [m];
        
        part wheelAssemblies : WheelAssembly[4];
    }
    
    part def WheelAssembly {
        part wheel : Wheel;
        part brakeDisc : BrakeDisc;
        
        constraint fitmentConstraint {
            brakeDisc.diameter < wheel.outerDiameter
        }
    }
    
    part def Wheel {
        part rim : Rim;
        part tire : Tire;
        
        attribute outerDiameter : LengthValue = rim.diameter + 2 * tire.height;
    }
    
    part def Rim {
        attribute diameter : LengthValue = 18 [in];
    }
    
    part def Tire {
        attribute width : LengthValue = 245 [mm];
        attribute height : LengthValue = 45 [mm];
        attribute treadDepth : LengthValue = 6.0 [mm];
        
        constraint safetyRegulation {
            treadDepth >= 3.5 [mm]
        }
    }
    
    part def BrakeDisc {
        attribute radius : LengthValue = 95 [mm];
        attribute diameter : LengthValue = 2 * radius;
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Core data types needed:
   - Unsigned integers (non-negative)
   - Unsigned floating-point numbers (non-negative)
   - Date-time
   - String
   - Boolean

2. Color labeling system:
   - Three status levels: critical, warning, normal
   - Associated colors: red, yellow, green
   - Need enumeration for both status and color
   - Need association/mapping between them

3. Physical dimensions:
   - Diameter parameter in millimeters
   - Three options: Small (60mm), Medium (70mm), Large (80mm)
   - Default value: Small
   - Need enumeration with associated values

4. Design considerations:
   - Future extensibility
   - Value constraints enforcement
   - Status-color association logic

SysML v2 mapping:
- Use `attribute def` for basic data types with constraints
- Use `enum def` for enumerations
- Use `attribute` for specific properties
- Use constraints for value restrictions
- Use metadata for units
- Consider using functions or constraints for status-color mapping
</scratchpad>

package DataManagementSystem {
    import ScalarValues::*;
    import ISQ::*;
    import SI::*;
    
    attribute def UnsignedInteger :> Integer {
        constraint { self >= 0 }
    }
    
    attribute def UnsignedFloat :> Real {
        constraint { self >= 0.0 }
    }
    
    attribute def DateTime :> String;
    
    enum def StatusLevel {
        enum critical;
        enum warning;
        enum normal;
    }
    
    enum def StatusColor {
        enum red;
        enum yellow;
        enum green;
    }
    
    enum def DiameterSize {
        enum small = 60;
        enum medium = 70;
        enum large = 80;
    }
    
    attribute def Diameter :> LengthValue {
        attribute size : DiameterSize default DiameterSize::small;
        attribute :>> num = size;
        attribute :>> mRef = mm;
    }
    
    attribute def StatusMapping {
        attribute level : StatusLevel;
        attribute color : StatusColor;
        
        constraint statusColorAssociation {
            (level == StatusLevel::critical) == (color == StatusColor::red) &
            (level == StatusLevel::warning) == (color == StatusColor::yellow) &
            (level == StatusLevel::normal) == (color == StatusColor::green)
        }
    }
    
    part def SystemDataTypes {
        attribute unsignedInt : UnsignedInteger;
        attribute unsignedFloat : UnsignedFloat;
        attribute dateTime : DateTime;
        attribute textData : String;
        attribute flag : Boolean;
        attribute diameter : Diameter;
        attribute status : StatusMapping;
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key functional/non-functional information:
   - Manage spare parts as Bags (unordered, allows duplicates)
   - Store integers as Lists (ordered, allows duplicates)
   - Manage strings as Sets (unordered, no duplicates)
   - Manage personnel using OrderedSets (ordered, no duplicates)
   - Support nested collections: List<Set<Person>>
   - Process real numbers as fixed-length arrays (length 4)
   - Support integration and interaction with other business functions

2. Mapping to SysML v2:
   - Need to define item definitions for SparePart and Person
   - Use attribute definitions with multiplicity and collection types
   - Bag: unordered, nonunique
   - List: ordered, nonunique
   - Set: unordered, unique
   - OrderedSet: ordered, unique
   - Array[4]: fixed size array
   - Define a part for the management system
   - Include attributes for each collection type
</scratchpad>

package CollectionManagementSystem {
    
    item def SparePart {
        attribute id : String;
        attribute name : String;
        attribute quantity : Integer;
    }
    
    item def Person {
        attribute id : String;
        attribute name : String;
        attribute role : String;
    }
    
    part def ManagementSystem {
        attribute sparePartsBag : SparePart[*] unordered nonunique;
        attribute integerList : Integer[*] ordered nonunique;
        attribute stringSet : String[*] unordered unique;
        attribute personnelOrderedSet : Person[*] ordered unique;
        attribute nestedPersonSets : Set<Person>[*] ordered nonunique;
        attribute realNumberArray : Real[4];
        
        action retrieveSparePartsByName(in searchName : String) : SparePart[*];
        action addPersonToSet(in person : Person, inout targetSet : Person[*]);
        action processRealNumbers(in numbers : Real[4]) : Real;
    }
    
    part managementSystemInstance : ManagementSystem;
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirement step by step:

Key functional information:
1. System automates photography process
2. User provides shooting scene as input
3. System performs focus processing on the scene
4. System generates an image suitable for shooting
5. System converts the image into a photograph through shooting operation
6. Process is seamlessly integrated
7. No user intervention needed for focusing/shooting details

Key non-functional information:
1. Simplifies photography workflow
2. Easy and efficient for users
3. Automated process

Mapping to SysML v2:
- Package for organizing the model
- Part definitions for main components (AutomatedPhotographySystem, FocusProcessor, ImageCapture)
- Item definitions for data flow (Scene, FocusedImage, Photograph)
- Action definitions for behaviors (providesScene, focusProcessing, imageCapture)
- Usage/allocation to show the integrated system
- Requirements to capture the non-functional aspects
</scratchpad>

package AutomatedPhotographySystem {
    
    item def Scene;
    item def FocusedImage;
    item def Photograph;
    
    part def User {
        out port sceneOutput : Scene;
    }
    
    part def FocusProcessor {
        in port sceneInput : Scene;
        out port focusedImageOutput : FocusedImage;
        
        action focusProcessing {
            in scene : Scene;
            out focusedImage : FocusedImage;
        }
    }
    
    part def ImageCapture {
        in port focusedImageInput : FocusedImage;
        out port photographOutput : Photograph;
        
        action shootImage {
            in image : FocusedImage;
            out photo : Photograph;
        }
    }
    
    part def AutomatedPhotographySystem {
        part user : User;
        part focusProcessor : FocusProcessor;
        part imageCapture : ImageCapture;
        
        interface : user.sceneOutput to focusProcessor.sceneInput;
        interface : focusProcessor.focusedImageOutput to imageCapture.focusedImageInput;
        
        action automatedPhotography {
            action provideScene : user::sceneOutput;
            then action processFocus : focusProcessor::focusProcessing;
            then action capturePhoto : imageCapture::shootImage;
            
            flow provideScene.out to processFocus.scene;
            flow processFocus.focusedImage to capturePhoto.image;
        }
    }
    
    requirement def SeamlessIntegration {
        doc /* The system shall provide seamless integration between focus processing 
             and image capture without user intervention */
    }
    
    requirement def SimplifiedWorkflow {
        doc /* The system shall simplify the photography workflow by automating 
             focus and shooting details */
    }
    
    requirement def UserEfficiency {
        doc /* The system shall enable users to obtain photographs easily 
             and efficiently */
    }
    
    satisfy SeamlessIntegration by AutomatedPhotographySystem;
    satisfy SimplifiedWorkflow by AutomatedPhotographySystem;
    satisfy UserEfficiency by AutomatedPhotographySystem;
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirement step by step:

1. Key functional information:
- System provides automatic braking control
- Activates when key turned to start position
- Monitors brake pedal status
- Monitors traction information (road adhesion)
- Detects brake pressure from driver input
- Evaluates traction variations
- Adjusts brake pressure
- Adjusts modulation frequency
- Operates automatically without intervention

2. Key non-functional information:
- Safe and reliable braking performance
- Enhanced driving safety
- Enhanced comfort
- Optimal state operation
- Continuous monitoring
- Dynamic regulation

3. SysML v2 mapping:
- Package for overall system
- Part definitions for major components
- Actions for behaviors
- Requirements for constraints
- Interfaces for interactions
- States for system modes
- Attributes for properties
- Item flows for information exchange
</scratchpad>

package AutomaticBrakingControlSystem {
    
    part def Vehicle;
    part def BrakingControlSystem;
    part def BrakePedal;
    part def TractionSensor;
    part def BrakeActuator;
    part def IgnitionSwitch;
    
    item def BrakePressure;
    item def TractionData;
    item def ModulationFrequency;
    item def KeyPosition;
    
    requirement def SafeBrakingPerformance {
        doc /* The system shall provide safe and reliable braking performance under various operating conditions */
    }
    
    requirement def AutomaticOperation {
        doc /* The system shall operate automatically without user intervention */
    }
    
    requirement def ContinuousMonitoring {
        doc /* The system shall continuously monitor brake pedal status and traction information */
    }
    
    action def MonitorBrakePedal {
        in brakePedalStatus;
        out detectedPressure : BrakePressure;
    }
    
    action def MonitorTraction {
        in roadConditions;
        out tractionInfo : TractionData;
    }
    
    action def AdjustBraking {
        in currentPressure : BrakePressure;
        in tractionVariation : TractionData;
        out adjustedPressure : BrakePressure;
        out modulationFreq : ModulationFrequency;
    }
    
    part vehicleSystem : Vehicle {
        part brakingControl : BrakingControlSystem {
            attribute isActive : Boolean;
            
            part ignition : IgnitionSwitch {
                attribute keyPosition : String;
            }
            
            part brakePedal : BrakePedal {
                attribute pedalPressure : Real;
            }
            
            part tractionSensor : TractionSensor {
                attribute roadAdhesion : Real;
            }
            
            part brakeActuator : BrakeActuator {
                attribute appliedPressure : Real;
                attribute modulationFrequency : Real;
            }
            
            perform monitorPedal : MonitorBrakePedal;
            perform monitorTraction : MonitorTraction;
            perform adjustBraking : AdjustBraking;
            
            state systemStates {
                entry state off;
                state active {
                    entry action {
                        assign isActive := true;
                    }
                    do action {
                        perform monitorPedal;
                        perform monitorTraction;
                        perform adjustBraking;
                    }
                }
                
                transition activation
                    first off
                    then active
                    when ignition.keyPosition == "START";
            }
            
            flow of BrakePressure from brakePedal to monitorPedal.brakePedalStatus;
            flow of TractionData from tractionSensor to monitorTraction.roadConditions;
            flow of BrakePressure from monitorPedal.detectedPressure to adjustBraking.currentPressure;
            flow of TractionData from monitorTraction.tractionInfo to adjustBraking.tractionVariation;
            flow of BrakePressure from adjustBraking.adjustedPressure to brakeActuator;
            flow of ModulationFrequency from adjustBraking.modulationFreq to brakeActuator;
            
            satisfy requirement SafeBrakingPerformance by adjustBraking;
            satisfy requirement AutomaticOperation by systemStates;
            satisfy requirement ContinuousMonitoring by monitorPedal, monitorTraction;
        }
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirement step by step:

1. Key functional information:
   - System simulates a vehicle moving in 1D
   - Predicts position over time based on power input
   - Takes inputs: mass, initial position, initial velocity, time interval, power sequence
   - Calculates speed and position sequentially
   - Outputs position trajectory

2. Key non-functional information:
   - One-dimensional straight path constraint
   - Time-varying power input
   - Sequential calculation requirement

3. Mapping to SysML v2:
   - Need a package to contain the model
   - Define parts for the vehicle and simulation system
   - Define attributes for mass, position, velocity, time interval
   - Define ports for power input and position output
   - Define actions for calculating speed and position
   - Define constraints for 1D motion
   - Define item definitions for data types
</scratchpad>

package VehicleMotionSimulation {
    import ScalarValues::*;
    import ISQ::*;
    import SI::*;
    
    item def PowerProfile {
        attribute timeSteps : Real[*] ordered;
        attribute powerValues : PowerValue[*] ordered;
    }
    
    item def TrajectoryData {
        attribute timePoints : Real[*] ordered;
        attribute positions : LengthValue[*] ordered;
    }
    
    part def Vehicle {
        attribute mass : MassValue;
        attribute position : LengthValue;
        attribute velocity : SpeedValue;
        attribute acceleration : AccelerationValue;
        
        port powerInput : PowerValue;
    }
    
    part def SimulationController {
        attribute timeStep : TimeValue;
        attribute currentTime : TimeValue = 0 [s];
        
        port powerSequenceInput : PowerProfile;
        port trajectoryOutput : TrajectoryData;
    }
    
    part def VehicleMotionSimulator {
        part vehicle : Vehicle;
        part controller : SimulationController;
        
        attribute initialPosition : LengthValue;
        attribute initialVelocity : SpeedValue;
        
        action simulate {
            in vehicleMass : MassValue;
            in initPos : LengthValue;
            in initVel : SpeedValue;
            in deltaT : TimeValue;
            in powerProfile : PowerProfile;
            out trajectory : TrajectoryData;
            
            bind vehicle.mass = vehicleMass;
            bind vehicle.position = initPos;
            bind vehicle.velocity = initVel;
            bind controller.timeStep = deltaT;
            
            action step stepCalculation[1..*] {
                in power : PowerValue;
                in dt : TimeValue;
                
                calc force : ForceValue = power / vehicle.velocity;
                calc vehicle.acceleration : AccelerationValue = force / vehicle.mass;
                calc vehicle.velocity : SpeedValue = vehicle.velocity + vehicle.acceleration * dt;
                calc vehicle.position : LengthValue = vehicle.position + vehicle.velocity * dt;
            }
        }
        
        constraint oneDimensionalMotion {
            doc /* Vehicle moves only along a straight path */
        }
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze this step-by-step:

1. Key functional information:
- System controls vehicle start-stop process
- Initial state: off
- States: off, starting, operating
- Transitions triggered by: start signal, stop signal, power-on signal
- Conditions: brake pedal must be depressed before power-on
- Actions during transitions:
  - Send start signal to controller when power-on received
  - Perform self-check when entering operating state
  - Continuously supply power in operating state
  - Apply parking brake when leaving operating state

2. Non-functional requirements:
- Safety and reliability of start-stop process
- Coordinated control with controller

3. SysML v2 mapping:
- Use a state machine to model the behavior
- States: off, starting, operating
- Transitions with triggers and guards
- Entry/exit actions for states
- Send actions for signals
- Part definition for the system
- Requirements for safety and reliability
</scratchpad>

package VehicleStartStopSystem {
    
    part def VehicleStartStopController {
        attribute brakePedalDepressed : Boolean;
        
        port controllerPort {
            out item startSignalToController;
        }
    }
    
    part vehicleController : VehicleStartStopController {
        
        state startStopStateMachine {
            entry; then off;
            
            state off;
            
            state starting {
                entry action sendStartSignal {
                    send startSignalToController via controllerPort;
                }
            }
            
            state operating {
                entry action performSelfCheck;
                do action continuouslySupplyPower;
                exit action applyParkingBrake;
            }
            
            transition off_to_starting : off --> starting {
                trigger startSignal;
            }
            
            transition starting_to_operating : starting --> operating {
                trigger powerOnSignal;
                guard brakePedalDepressed;
            }
            
            transition operating_to_off : operating --> off {
                trigger stopSignal;
            }
        }
    }
    
    requirement def SafetyReliability {
        doc /* The system shall ensure the safety and reliability of the vehicle's start-stop process */
    }
    
    requirement def CoordinatedControl {
        doc /* The system shall provide coordinated control with the controller */
    }
    
    satisfy SafetyReliability by vehicleController;
    satisfy CoordinatedControl by vehicleController;
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key Components/Parts:
   - Driver
   - Cruise Controller
   - Speedometer
   - Engine
   - Vehicle (contains the other components)

2. Key Interfaces/Ports:
   - Driver sends set speed command
   - Cruise Controller receives set speed command
   - Speedometer sends actual speed to Cruise Controller
   - Cruise Controller sends fuel control commands to Engine
   - Engine receives fuel control commands

3. Key Behaviors:
   - Driver activates cruise function
   - Cruise Controller processes speed information
   - Speedometer collects real-time speed
   - Engine adjusts output based on fuel commands

4. Information Flow (Events):
   - Set speed command (Driver  Cruise Controller)
   - Actual speed (Speedometer  Cruise Controller)
   - Fuel control command (Cruise Controller  Engine)

5. System Structure:
   - Vehicle is the main system containing all components
   - Components interact through event-based communication

Mapping to SysML v2:
- Use part definitions for components
- Use part usages for instances
- Use ports for interfaces
- Use connections for information flow
- Use actions/behaviors for functional aspects
</scratchpad>

package CruiseControlSystem {
    
    part def Driver {
        port setSpeedOut : ~SetSpeedCommand;
    }
    
    part def CruiseController {
        port setSpeedIn : SetSpeedCommand;
        port actualSpeedIn : ActualSpeed;
        port fuelCommandOut : ~FuelControlCommand;
    }
    
    part def Speedometer {
        port actualSpeedOut : ~ActualSpeed;
    }
    
    part def Engine {
        port fuelCommandIn : FuelControlCommand;
    }
    
    part def Vehicle {
        part driver : Driver;
        part cruiseController : CruiseController;
        part speedometer : Speedometer;
        part engine : Engine;
        
        connection : driver.setSpeedOut to cruiseController.setSpeedIn;
        connection : speedometer.actualSpeedOut to cruiseController.actualSpeedIn;
        connection : cruiseController.fuelCommandOut to engine.fuelCommandIn;
    }
    
    port def SetSpeedCommand {
        attribute desiredSpeed : Real;
    }
    
    port def ActualSpeed {
        attribute currentSpeed : Real;
    }
    
    port def FuelControlCommand {
        attribute fuelRate : Real;
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key functional requirements:
   - Objects have mass attributes (simpleMass and totalMass)
   - Basic objects (simpleThing): totalMass = simpleMass
   - Composite objects (compositeThing): can contain subcomponents
   - Composite totalMass = simpleMass + sum of all subcomponents' totalMass
   - Hierarchical mass aggregation

2. Key non-functional requirements:
   - Automatic calculation
   - Hierarchical management
   - Mass statistics at all levels

3. SysML v2 mapping:
   - Need abstract part definition for common mass attributes
   - SimpleThing as a specialized part
   - CompositeThing as a specialized part with composition
   - Attribute definitions for simpleMass and totalMass
   - Constraint for totalMass calculation
   - Recursive composition pattern for hierarchical structure
</scratchpad>

package MassAggregationSystem {
    
    abstract part def MassObject {
        attribute simpleMass : Real;
        attribute totalMass : Real;
    }
    
    part def SimpleThing :> MassObject {
        assert constraint {
            totalMass == simpleMass
        }
    }
    
    part def CompositeThing :> MassObject {
        part subcomponents : MassObject[0..*];
        
        assert constraint {
            totalMass == simpleMass + subcomponents.totalMass->sum()
        }
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key functional requirements:
   - Calculate vehicle dynamics core parameters (power output, acceleration, speed, position)
   - Calculate actual available power output based on:
     - Wheel power
     - Aerodynamic drag coefficient
     - Friction coefficient
     - Vehicle mass
     - Speed
   - Deduce acceleration from effective power, mass, and current speed
   - Calculate speed at any moment using acceleration, initial speed, and time
   - Estimate displacement based on speed and time

2. Non-functional requirements:
   - High accuracy
   - Clear logical relationships between parameters
   - Results convenient for practical engineering applications

3. Mapping to SysML v2:
   - Create a package for the vehicle dynamics system
   - Define parts for the vehicle and its subsystems
   - Define attributes for all the parameters mentioned
   - Create calculations/constraints for the relationships
   - Define actions for the various calculations
   - Use requirements to capture the functional and non-functional needs
</scratchpad>

package VehicleDynamicsSystem {
    import ScalarValues::*;
    import Quantities::*;
    import MeasurementReferences::*;
    import SI::*;
    
    part def Vehicle {
        attribute mass : MassValue;
        attribute speed : SpeedValue;
        attribute acceleration : AccelerationValue;
        attribute position : LengthValue;
        attribute wheelPower : PowerValue;
        attribute effectivePower : PowerValue;
        attribute aerodynamicDragCoefficient : Real;
        attribute frictionCoefficient : Real;
        attribute initialSpeed : SpeedValue;
        attribute time : TimeValue;
        
        calc def calculateEffectivePower {
            in wheelPower : PowerValue;
            in aerodynamicDragCoefficient : Real;
            in frictionCoefficient : Real;
            in mass : MassValue;
            in speed : SpeedValue;
            return effectivePower : PowerValue;
        }
        
        calc def calculateAcceleration {
            in effectivePower : PowerValue;
            in mass : MassValue;
            in speed : SpeedValue;
            return acceleration : AccelerationValue;
        }
        
        calc def calculateSpeed {
            in acceleration : AccelerationValue;
            in initialSpeed : SpeedValue;
            in time : TimeValue;
            return speed : SpeedValue;
        }
        
        calc def calculateDisplacement {
            in speed : SpeedValue;
            in time : TimeValue;
            return displacement : LengthValue;
        }
    }
    
    part vehicleDynamicsCalculator : Vehicle {
        perform action calculateDynamics {
            action calculatePower : calculateEffectivePower {
                in wheelPower = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.wheelPower;
                in aerodynamicDragCoefficient = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.aerodynamicDragCoefficient;
                in frictionCoefficient = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.frictionCoefficient;
                in mass = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.mass;
                in speed = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.speed;
                out effectivePower = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.effectivePower;
            }
            
            then action calculateAcc : calculateAcceleration {
                in effectivePower = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.effectivePower;
                in mass = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.mass;
                in speed = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.speed;
                out acceleration = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.acceleration;
            }
            
            then action calculateVelocity : calculateSpeed {
                in acceleration = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.acceleration;
                in initialSpeed = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.initialSpeed;
                in time = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.time;
                out speed = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.speed;
            }
            
            then action calculatePosition : calculateDisplacement {
                in speed = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.speed;
                in time = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.time;
                out displacement = vehicleDynamicsCalculator.position;
            }
        }
    }
    
    requirement def VehicleDynamicsRequirements {
        doc /* The system must calculate core vehicle dynamics parameters */
        
        requirement calculatePowerOutput {
            doc /* System shall calculate actual available power output based on wheel power,
                   aerodynamic drag coefficient, friction coefficient, vehicle mass, and speed */
            subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        }
        
        requirement deduceAcceleration {
            doc /* System shall deduce vehicle acceleration based on effective power, mass, and current speed */
            subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        }
        
        requirement calculateSpeedAtTime {
            doc /* System shall calculate vehicle speed at any given moment using acceleration, initial speed, and time */
            subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        }
        
        requirement estimateDisplacement {
            doc /* System shall estimate vehicle displacement based on speed and time */
            subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        }
        
        requirement highAccuracy {
            doc /* System shall provide high accuracy in all calculations */
            subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        }
        
        requirement clearParameterRelationships {
            doc /* System shall maintain clear logical relationships between all parameters */
            subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        }
        
        requirement practicalEngineering {
            doc /* System results shall be convenient for practical engineering applications */
            subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        }
    }
    
    satisfy requirement calculatePowerOutput by vehicleDynamicsCalculator.calculatePower;
    satisfy requirement deduceAcceleration by vehicleDynamicsCalculator.calculateAcc;
    satisfy requirement calculateSpeedAtTime by vehicleDynamicsCalculator.calculateVelocity;
    satisfy requirement estimateDisplacement by vehicleDynamicsCalculator.calculatePosition;
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirement step by step:

1. Key functional information:
- Simulate and compute dynamic behavior of vehicles during straight-line driving
- Calculate vehicle's acceleration, speed, and position
- Consider aerodynamic drag and rolling resistance
- Use wheel-end output power and total vehicle mass
- Allow users to set key parameters
- Support performance analysis, energy consumption simulation, and driving strategy optimization

2. Key non-functional information:
- Provide accurate physical modeling
- Flexible parameter setting
- Dynamic calculation based on time steps

3. Mapping to SysML v2:
- Need a package to contain the model
- Define parts for vehicle, aerodynamics, resistance
- Define attributes for physical properties (mass, drag coefficient, rolling resistance coefficient, power, speed, position, acceleration)
- Define calculations/constraints for the physics equations
- Define actions for the simulation behavior
- Use calc definitions for reusable calculations
- Define requirements to capture the system needs
</scratchpad>

package VehicleDynamicsSimulation {
    import SI::*;
    import ISQ::*;
    import ScalarValues::*;
    
    part def Vehicle {
        attribute mass : MassValue;
        attribute position : LengthValue;
        attribute speed : SpeedValue;
        attribute acceleration : AccelerationValue;
        attribute wheelEndPower : PowerValue;
        attribute dragCoefficient : Real;
        attribute rollingResistanceCoefficient : Real;
        attribute frontalArea : AreaValue;
        
        calc aerodynamicDrag : ForceValue = 0.5 * 1.225[kg/m^3] * dragCoefficient * frontalArea * speed^2;
        calc rollingResistance : ForceValue = rollingResistanceCoefficient * mass * 9.81[m/s^2];
        calc totalResistance : ForceValue = aerodynamicDrag + rollingResistance;
        calc drivingForce : ForceValue = wheelEndPower / speed;
        calc netForce : ForceValue = drivingForce - totalResistance;
    }
    
    calc def computeAcceleration(vehicle : Vehicle) : AccelerationValue {
        vehicle.netForce / vehicle.mass
    }
    
    calc def updateSpeed(currentSpeed : SpeedValue, acceleration : AccelerationValue, timeStep : TimeValue) : SpeedValue {
        currentSpeed + acceleration * timeStep
    }
    
    calc def updatePosition(currentPosition : LengthValue, speed : SpeedValue, timeStep : TimeValue) : LengthValue {
        currentPosition + speed * timeStep
    }
    
    action def SimulateVehicleDynamics {
        in vehicle : Vehicle;
        in initialSpeed : SpeedValue;
        in initialPosition : LengthValue;
        in timeStep : TimeValue;
        in simulationDuration : TimeValue;
        
        out finalSpeed : SpeedValue;
        out finalPosition : LengthValue;
        out trajectory : LengthValue[*];
        
        action simulationLoop {
            first start;
            then merge continueOrStop;
            
            action continueOrStop : DecisionNode {
                if currentTime < simulationDuration then computeStep
                else done;
            }
            
            action computeStep {
                vehicle.acceleration := computeAcceleration(vehicle);
                vehicle.speed := updateSpeed(vehicle.speed, vehicle.acceleration, timeStep);
                vehicle.position := updatePosition(vehicle.position, vehicle.speed, timeStep);
                trajectory := trajectory->including(vehicle.position);
                currentTime := currentTime + timeStep;
                then continueOrStop;
            }
            
            action initialize {
                vehicle.speed := initialSpeed;
                vehicle.position := initialPosition;
                currentTime := 0[s];
                trajectory := Sequence{initialPosition};
                then continueOrStop;
            }
            
            state start;
            transition first start then initialize;
            
            state done;
            action setOutputs {
                finalSpeed := vehicle.speed;
                finalPosition := vehicle.position;
            }
            transition continueOrStop.done then setOutputs then done;
        }
    }
    
    requirement def VehicleDynamicsRequirements {
        doc /* The system shall simulate and compute dynamic behavior of vehicles during straight-line driving */
        
        requirement aerodynamicConsideration {
            doc /* The system shall consider aerodynamic drag in calculations */
        }
        
        requirement rollingResistanceConsideration {
            doc /* The system shall consider rolling resistance in calculations */
        }
        
        requirement dynamicCalculation {
            doc /* The system shall dynamically calculate acceleration, speed, and position based on time steps */
        }
        
        requirement parameterFlexibility {
            doc /* The system shall allow users to flexibly set key parameters */
        }
        
        requirement accurateModeling {
            doc /* The system shall provide accurate physical modeling */
        }
    }
    
    part vehicleDynamicsSystem : Vehicle {
        perform SimulateVehicleDynamics(
            vehicle = vehicleDynamicsSystem,
            initialSpeed = initialSpeed,
            initialPosition = initialPosition,
            timeStep = timeStep,
            simulationDuration = simulationDuration
        );
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirement step by step:

1. Key functional information:
   - System manages vehicle's total mass
   - Vehicle consists of: chassis, engine, gearbox
   - Each component has its own mass parameter
   - System calculates total mass
   - System checks compliance with 2,500 kg limit
   - System issues overweight warning if limit exceeded

2. Key non-functional information:
   - Maximum permitted limit: 2,500 kg
   - Weight regulation compliance

3. SysML v2 mapping:
   - Need a package to contain the model
   - Define parts for vehicle components (chassis, engine, gearbox)
   - Define attributes for mass values
   - Define a constraint for the 2,500 kg limit
   - Define a requirement for the mass limit
   - Define an action/behavior for calculating total mass
   - Define a verification case to check compliance
   - Use assert to check the constraint
</scratchpad>

package VehicleMassManagementSystem {
    import ScalarValues::*;
    import ISQ::*;
    import SI::*;
    
    part def Vehicle {
        attribute totalMass : MassValue;
        
        part chassis : Chassis;
        part engine : Engine;
        part gearbox : Gearbox;
        
        constraint massLimit {
            totalMass.num <= 2500
        }
        
        calc totalMassCalculation : MassValue {
            chassis.mass + engine.mass + gearbox.mass
        }
        
        attribute :>> totalMass = totalMassCalculation;
    }
    
    part def Chassis {
        attribute mass : MassValue;
    }
    
    part def Engine {
        attribute mass : MassValue;
    }
    
    part def Gearbox {
        attribute mass : MassValue;
    }
    
    requirement def VehicleMassRequirement {
        doc /* The vehicle's total mass shall not exceed 2,500 kilograms */
        
        attribute maxPermittedMass : MassValue = 2500[kg];
        
        require constraint {
            doc /* Total mass of chassis, engine, and gearbox must not exceed maximum permitted limit */
        }
    }
    
    requirement vehicleMassReq : VehicleMassRequirement;
    
    part vehicle : Vehicle {
        satisfy vehicleMassReq by massLimit;
    }
    
    verification def MassComplianceVerification {
        subject vehicle : Vehicle;
        
        verify requirement vehicleMassReq;
        
        return verdict : VerdictKind;
    }
    
    verification massComplianceCheck : MassComplianceVerification {
        subject :>> vehicle;
        
        action checkTotalMass {
            calc isOverweight : Boolean = vehicle.totalMass.num > 2500;
            
            if isOverweight {
                send OverweightWarning() to vehicle;
            }
            
            assert constraint { !isOverweight }
        }
        
        return :>> verdict = checkTotalMass.isOverweight ? fail : pass;
    }
    
    message OverweightWarning {
        attribute totalMass : MassValue;
        attribute exceededBy : MassValue;
    }
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirements step by step:

1. Key functional/non-functional information:
   - Vehicle mass constraints:
     - With full fuel tank: total mass  2000 kg
     - With empty fuel tank: total mass  1500 kg
     - Total mass = dry mass + fuel mass
   - Engine requirements:
     - Must transmit torque to transmission via clutch interface
     - Must deliver torque according to speed-torque curve (Table 1)
   - System goals: vehicle mass control, powertrain interface and performance

2. Mapping to SysML v2:
   - Package for organizing
   - Part definitions for Vehicle, Engine, Transmission, Clutch
   - Attributes for mass properties
   - Constraints for mass requirements
   - Interface definitions for torque transmission
   - Requirements for capturing the stated requirements
   - Connection/interface between engine and transmission via clutch
</scratchpad>

package VehicleSystem {
    
    part def Vehicle {
        attribute dryMass : Real;
        attribute fuelMass : Real;
        attribute totalMass : Real = dryMass + fuelMass;
        
        part engine : Engine;
        part transmission : Transmission;
        part clutch : Clutch;
    }
    
    part def Engine {
        attribute torqueOutput : Real;
        attribute speed : Real;
        port torquePort : TorqueInterface;
    }
    
    part def Transmission {
        port torqueInputPort : TorqueInterface;
    }
    
    part def Clutch {
        port engineSide : TorqueInterface;
        port transmissionSide : TorqueInterface;
    }
    
    interface def TorqueInterface {
        attribute torque : Real;
    }
    
    requirement def VehicleMassRequirements {
        doc /* The vehicle mass must meet constraints under different fuel conditions */
        
        requirement fullTankMassLimit {
            doc /* With full fuel tank, total mass must not exceed 2000 kg */
            assume constraint { vehicle.fuelMass == vehicle.fuelTankCapacity }
            require constraint { vehicle.totalMass <= 2000 }
        }
        
        requirement emptyTankMassLimit {
            doc /* With empty fuel tank, total mass must not exceed 1500 kg */
            assume constraint { vehicle.fuelMass == 0 }
            require constraint { vehicle.totalMass <= 1500 }
        }
    }
    
    requirement def EngineTorqueTransmission {
        doc /* Engine must transmit torque to transmission via clutch */
        subject engine : Engine;
        
        requirement torqueDelivery {
            doc /* Engine must deliver torque according to speed-torque curve */
            require constraint { engine.torqueOutput == torqueCurve(engine.speed) }
        }
    }
    
    part vehicleInstance : Vehicle {
        connect engine.torquePort to clutch.engineSide;
        connect clutch.transmissionSide to transmission.torqueInputPort;
    }
    
    satisfy VehicleMassRequirements by vehicleInstance;
    satisfy EngineTorqueTransmission by vehicleInstance.engine;
}

<scratchpad>
Let me analyze the requirement step by step:

1. Key functional information:
   - Conduct selection analysis for engines
   - Support multiple engine types (four-cylinder, six-cylinder)
   - Aggregate and calculate performance indicators
   - Use unified evaluation function
   - Automatically screen and recommend optimal engine

2. Key non-functional information:
   - Performance indicators: power, mass, efficiency, cost
   - Goal: maximize performance and economic efficiency

3. SysML v2 mapping:
   - Package for organization
   - Part definitions for engine types
   - Attributes for performance indicators
   - Analysis case for selection analysis
   - Calculation definitions for aggregation and evaluation
   - Requirements for objectives
</scratchpad>

package EngineSelectionSystem {
    
    import ScalarValues::*;
    
    attribute def Power :> ScalarQuantityValue {
        attribute unit :> MeasurementUnit;
    }
    
    attribute def Mass :> ScalarQuantityValue {
        attribute unit :> MeasurementUnit;
    }
    
    attribute def Efficiency :> Real;
    
    attribute def Cost :> ScalarQuantityValue {
        attribute unit :> MeasurementUnit;
    }
    
    attribute def EvaluationScore :> Real;
    
    part def Engine {
        attribute power : Power;
        attribute mass : Mass;
        attribute efficiency : Efficiency;
        attribute cost : Cost;
        attribute evaluationScore : EvaluationScore;
    }
    
    part def FourCylinderEngine :> Engine;
    
    part def SixCylinderEngine :> Engine;
    
    calc def PerformanceAggregation {
        in engine : Engine;
        return aggregatedMetrics : Engine;
    }
    
    calc def UnifiedEvaluationFunction {
        in engine : Engine;
        return score : EvaluationScore;
    }
    
    calc def OptimalEngineSelection {
        in candidates : Engine[*];
        return optimal : Engine;
    }
    
    analysis def EngineSelectionAnalysis {
        subject engines : Engine[*];
        
        calc performanceCalc : PerformanceAggregation {
            in engine = engines;
        }
        
        calc evaluation : UnifiedEvaluationFunction {
            in engine = performanceCalc.aggregatedMetrics;
        }
        
        calc selection : OptimalEngineSelection {
            in candidates = engines;
        }
        
        return selectedEngine : Engine = selection.optimal;
    }
    
    requirement def MaximizePerformance {
        doc /* The system shall maximize engine performance */
        subject engine : Engine;
    }
    
    requirement def MaximizeEconomicEfficiency {
        doc /* The system shall maximize economic efficiency */
        subject engine : Engine;
    }
    
    requirement def ComprehensiveEvaluation {
        doc /* The system shall use a unified evaluation function to assess engines based on power, mass, efficiency, and cost */
        subject evaluationFunction : UnifiedEvaluationFunction;
    }
    
    part engineSelectionSystem {
        part fourCylinderEngines : FourCylinderEngine[*];
        part sixCylinderEngines : SixCylinderEngine[*];
        
        perform analysis : EngineSelectionAnalysis {
            subject engines = fourCylinderEngines union sixCylinderEngines;
        }
    }
}
